senses.sense_definition: A greenhouse maintained at a moderately low temperature for growing plants that require cool conditions.

examples.text: The gardener moved the delicate alpine flowers to the <w>coolhouse</w> to protect them from the summer heat.
Orchids that cannot tolerate tropical humidity often thrive better in a well-ventilated <w>coolhouse</w> environment.

senses.sense_definition: A state of global climate characterized by cool temperatures and some polar ice, intermediate between a warm hothouse and a frozen icehouse state.

examples.text: Geological evidence suggests the planet entered a <w>coolhouse</w> state long before the major ice ages began.
Researchers study ancient sediment to understand how the Earth transitions from a hothouse to a <w>coolhouse</w> climate.
